intro: Hapalochilus concavibasalis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star-flower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale pink. Its leaves are narrow and arranged oppositely along the stem, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hapalochilus concavibasalis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
